Nitric Oxide Indicator Strips capture a simple, and non-invasive, saliva sample to determine the concentration of a salivary nitrite, a key biomarker, needed for the production and availability of Nitric Oxide. Each tube contains 25 Indicator Strips. How to Use: Step 1: During the morning before you drink or eat, wash your hands and gather saliva on your fingertip. Step 2: Place the saliva on the indicator strip pad. Don't put the strip in your mouth. Step 3: Compare your results to the color chart provided. The lighter pink, the more Nitric Oxide deficient you are. 25 strips Great for checking on heart health!

NOS & Heart health problems

NOS gene mutations can cause a reduced production of nitric oxide leading to constricted blood vessels, when this happens, it is harder for your heart to get the oxygen it needs to keep going.  The main concerns with NOS gene mutations are:
  • Coronary spasm
  • Heart attack
  • Stroke
  • Blood pressure control
  • Vasculature (arrangement of blood vessels in the body)
  • Migraines
  • Nervous system problems such as learning and memory
  • Immune system problems
  • Free radical damage
  • Infertility
NOS is a balancing act
  • Low levels of nitric oxide are bad because they can cause heart problems
  • Too much nitric oxide can be damaging as a result of too many free radicals or free radical damage
Testing for Nitric Oxide imbalances can be life saving/changing.  You can also get a phone consultation here to test for NOS gene mutations.

NOTE:  This test is ONLY AVAILABLE TO AUSTRALIAN RESIDENTS. N.A.D is a coenzyme found in all living cells. It plays a crucial role in cellular metabolism, especially in processes like energy production and DNA repair. NAD exists in two forms: NAD+ (oxidized form) – Acts as a carrier for electrons in metabolic reactions. It is essential for converting nutrients into energy by facilitating reactions in cellular respiration, especially in the Krebs cycle and the electron transport chain. NADH (reduced form) – This form donates electrons during various biochemical processes, particularly in ATP (energy) production. Nicotinamide Adenine Dinucleotide (N.A.D) NAD is also involved in the regulation of sirtuins, enzymes that play a role in aging, inflammation, and stress resistance. In recent years, NAD+ has gained attention for its potential in anti-aging therapies and enhancing mitochondrial function.

Symptoms of N.A.D deficiencies

  • Weakness
  • Tired
  • Forgetful
  • Fatigue
  • Mental brain fog
  • Dull and tired skin
  • Oxidative Stress
  • Insomnia
  • Memory recall, attention span and mental fatigue
  • Aging
  • Problems with methylation
  • Problems with nutrient urtication (Nutritional deficiencies)
  • Any energy problem

N.A.D Testing markers (What we test for)

  • NAD (NAD+)
  • NADH
  • NADPH
  • NADP
  • Nicotinamide (NAM)
  • Nicotinic Acid (NA)
  • NAD/NADH Ratio
  • NADP/NADPH
  • NAD/NADP Index

About the NAD Home Test Kit

The NAD home test kit is a convenient, accurate, professional way to find out if you have an NAD imbalance/s. After you purchase the NAD Home Test, you will receive a simple blood spot test kit in the mail.  The test kit comes with:
  • A blood spot home test kit
  • Full instructions and Laboratory request form
  • Complete instructions & tools for taking the test
  • Pre paid express post envelope to return the test to the laboratory (Australia Only).
Test results are sent to one of our professional health practitioners within 5 business days for evaluation.  Our practitioners contact you with the results and recommendations on any findings via email, mail or phone.

post_title: DIM + I3C with PQQ Seeking Health
post_content:
Are you exposed to plastics, conventional meat and dairy, or conventional household products on a regular basis?  Do you have estrogen dominance?

All of these have one thing in common - they contain chemicals that may harm human cells and promote free radicals in the body. In the presence of free radicals, estrogenic activity and estrogen metabolism are influenced. Toxin exposure typically affects the endocrine system by increasing estrogen production or estrogen activity. This is called estrogen dominance. The effects of estrogen in high quantities in the body should not be overlooked. Do you have estrogen dominance? Are you concerned about supporting a healthy hormone balance?† DIM+I3C is a targeted formula that supports healthy estrogen metabolism and a healthy oxidative stress responses associated with xenoestrogen exposure.† DIM (diindolylmethane) is a byproduct of I3C (indole-3-carbinol), a compound found in broccoli, cabbage and cruciferous vegetables. Both DIM and I3C are dietary indoles, which support normal processing of estrogen metabolites.† A healthy balance between steroid hormones is vital. Estrogen, progesterone, testosterone, and other adrenal hormones and sex hormones (androgens) are incredibly important for reproductive health, sexual health, and overall vitality. However, when estrogen levels get too high from toxin exposure, liver overload, or the use of prescriptions, other important hormones can drop to dangerously low levels. This can put adrenal health, emotional health, and female menses cycles in danger. PQQ (from Pyrroloquinoline Quinone Disodium Salt) is added to support healthy oxidation of free radicals due to xenoestrogen (chemical estrogen mimickers) exposure and higher estrogen overall. Oxidative stress due to free radicals has a wide impact on all epigenetic controls. Keeping these balanced helps to support the healthy expression of hormone balancing and detoxification genes. Hormones are such a large factor in mental well-being, as they play a part in neurotransmitter balance and feelings of joy.† DIM + I3C can specifically support healthy estrogen metabolism in individuals with high estrogen exposure. The incidence of higher estrogen may be more prevalent in the following individuals:†
  • Those exposed to toxins and free radicals
  • Those with a change in menopausal status
  • Those on hormonal therapy
  • Premenopausal and postmenopausal women
  • Those taking contraceptives
  • Those at risk for uncontrolled cell growth of the breast tissue
  • Those with abnormal ovarian tissue growth
  • Those struggling with weight issues
Seeking Health’s DIM + I3C is an important product to have on hand to support healthy estrogen metabolism. When your hormones are balanced and supported, you will feel calm and have healthy energy levels. Support that balance today!†

Unique blend of herbs, amino acids and nutrients tailored to support circulatory health and heart strength. Genoma Cardia is formulated to: support healthy heart function, assist in the maintenance of healthy blood pressure already in the normal range and promote strength of the circulatory system. Genoma Cardia is a unique blend of herbs, botanicals, amino acids and nutraceuticals including:
  • Hawthorn berry (Crataegus spp.) extract: The berries and flowers of Hawthorn were historically used as cardiac tonics in many historical cultures. Extracts from Hawthorn have been found to enhance oxygen flow to and utilization by the heart. Because of the high content of flavonoid compounds, extracts of Hawthorn have significant antioxidant activity.
  • L-Taurine: Taurine is the amino acid found in its highest concentration in the 'free amino acid pool' in heart tissue; apparently it is used extensively in maintaining healthy heart muscle.
  • Coenzyme Q10 : Coenzyme Q10 is an antioxidant that your body produces naturally. Coenzyme Q10 levels tend to be lower in people dealing with cardiovascular challenges, as it is thought that Coenzyme Q10 helps enhance the 'bioenergetics' of cardiac tissue. Levels of Coenzyme Q10 in your body decrease as you age
  • Terminalia arjuna Bark : Terminalia arjuna is a medicinal plant used as a cardiotonic in Ayurvedic Medicine. Scientific evidence indicates that it has strong antioxidant properties.
  • Salvia miltiorrhiza Root : Salvia and its preparations are currently used in China to treat patients who need cardiovascular support. It has been shown to exert a protective effect on cardiac muscle.

post_content:
Unique formula designed to support healthy metabolism, promote weight loss and maintain homeostasis. Inspired by traditional Ayurvedic medicine.

Glycoscia is an innovative, one-of-a-kind nutriceutical formula as an aid to weight loss, the maintenance of blood sugar levels already in the normal range, and the overall enhancement of a healthy metabolism.  Glycoscia’s key ingredient is Salacia reticulata, a traditional herb that has been used for thousands of years in Ayurvedic medicine.

Modern research has shown that Salacia plays an important role in supporting natural carbohydrate metabolism. When we consume sugars and starches, a very small amount is broken down by the enzymes in our saliva. However, by far the greater amount is metabolized in the small intestines, where the assimilated sugar can either be utilized immediately for the production of energy, or saved as fat for later use. One of the ways this is controlled is via special hormones within the cell called PPARs (Pee-Pars). The best studied of the PPARs is called PPAR-gamma (PPARG). PPARG is a key regulator of fatty acid storage and glucose metabolism; sort of like a traffic policeman, directing vehicles in either of two directions: 'burn carbs' or 'store fat.' Studies have shown that Salacia root exerts a healthful effect on PPARG, helping to maintain and balance its normal, optimal function.

In addition, in certain individuals, sometimes called 'hyper-assimilators,' a percentage of the undigested carbohydrate from a meal will reach the lower intestine and be broken down into simple sugars, which will then also be assimilated and either stored as fat or burned as energy. These individuals are known to have higher levels of a class of enzymes called glycosidases. Salacia has been shown to help insure normal, healthy levels of this enzyme, especially when combined with a sensible diet and exercise program.

Synergistic Co-Factors

  • Resveratrol: Resveratrol, a polyphenolic compound, is found primarily in red wine and red grape skins. In a now-famous Harvard study, mice fed resveratrol were reported over time to be thinner and healthier with increased life-spans. Each capsule of Glycoscia supplies a full 50 mg of Resveratrol, providing 50% trans-resveratrol compounds.
  • Quercetin: Nature's most important bioflavonoid, Quercetin supports a normal digestive and immune system.
  • Red Sage Root (Salvia miltiorrhiza): Used traditionally in Chinese medicine, recent research in the West confirms Salvia's importance in supporting healthy cardiovascular and liver function.
  • Maitake Mushroom: Adaptogen considered to be "The King of Mushrooms." Research suggests that Maitake appears to maintain blood sugar levels that are already in the normal range.

60 vegetarian capsules Suggested Use: One (1) capsule 2 times daily. Is this product vegetarian? Yes Usable by all types? Yes This 100% vegetarian product contains no sugar, salt, gluten, wheat, yeast, corn, soy, eggs or dairy, no preservatives, color or flavors, and no artificial ingredients.

post_content:
Seaweed-based supplement designed to promote optimal metabolic balance and thyroid health.

Seaweed-based supplement designed to promote optimal metabolic balance and thyroid health.

Dr. Peter D'Adamo:
"Sea vegetables, and in particular bladderwrack, have many unique characteristics and properties and are used extensively as food in coastal cuisines around the world. It's a positive sign to see this trend building in the Western countries as well."
The primary ingredient in Fucus Plus is bladderwrack (Fucus vesiculosis) seaweed. The unique composition of bladderwrack includes the unique monosaccharide fucose, and other long-chain sugars known as high molecular weight polysaccharides. Readers of Dr. D'Adamo's writings will know that fucose is part of the antigen that determines blood type O and the difference between secretors and non-secretors. Dr. Peter D'Adamo:
"All blood types have the sugar fucose as part of their distinguishing antigen. However, types A and B have other sugars as well. Only type O has fucose as the sole identifying antigen. This opens up the possibility that in this blood type fucose can provide a type of blocking protection from invaders that might try to hijack the type O immune system by attaching to its main antigen. "
The high molecular weight polysaccharides in Fucus vescuosis include fucoidin, which is known to inhibit the growth of many unfriendly bacteria, yeast, and viruses. "Many chronic conditions are known to be the result of so-called 'stealth infections'. These are often caused by bacteria that can evade the bodys denses by manufacturing biofilms, a type of protective slime. It is known that biofilms do no grow on seaweeds, a defense they've probably had to develop in order to survive the dangerous interface between land and sea." This plant was grown and harvested by trained marine botanists and immediately freeze-dried to preserve its molecular integrity. Fucus Plus is suitable for all blood types but may be particularly beneficial to blood type O individuals to help support a healthy digestive system. Bladderwrack may also provide specific benefits, such as helping to maintain a healthy overall body composition and supporting immune system health. Dr. Peter D'Adamo:
"Many people are unaware of just how deeply connected the thyroid and digestive tract are -- although it’s long been observed that problems in one organ often carry over to the other. Dr. D’Adamo discovered that a specific seaweed can help optimize and balance this network. "
Fucus vesiculosis contains iodine. If you are being treated for a thyroid condition, are allergic to shellfish, or are nursing or pregnant, consult your physician before taking this product.  
Dosage & Information
Directions 1 (one) capsule two times daily, or as directed by a physician
Size 60 capsules
Usable by all types? Yes, but may have special benefit for type O individuals
This 100% vegetarian product contains no sugar, salt, gluten, wheat, yeast, corn, soy, eggs or dairy, no preservatives, color or flavors, and no artificial ingredients.

post_content:
Blend of herbs, nutrients and vitamins to combat fatigue and support a healthy response to stress in Blood Types O and AB. Are you a Warrior or a Worrier? Catechol helps to maintain normal levels and activity of COMT, a critical enzyme that our nervous system, particularly the brain's prefrontal cortex, rely upon to organize and coordinate information from other parts of the brain. COMT is the symbol for the actual enzyme, known as catechol-O-methyltransferase. It is produced chiefly by nerve cells in the brain, but also produced elsewhere in the body,  including the liver, kidneys, and blood, form of the enzyme that helps control the levels of certain hormones.
"In today's modern world, occasional stress can be problematic. This "slow burn" can sometimes disrupt our ability to sleep, digest our meals properly, and maintain a healthy immune system. While occasional stress is a body's method of reacting to a challenge, it can also disrupt the body's natural reaction to any stimuli that disturbs its equilibrium, resulting in a fight or flight response. "
Maintaining proper and normal COMT activity insures that the prefrontal context of the brain is able to support balanced personality, the ability to plan, the inhibition of negative behaviors, and healthy abstract thinking, emotions, and working (short-term) memory. "Research indicates that individuals of different ABO blood types can have extremely different responses to occasional stress. And while any blood type can benefit from Catechol, I've clinically seen the need for it to be most common in blood type O individuals." This 100% vegetarian product has a unique three layer design:
  • Layer 1:A base of B vitamins (including methylcobalamin, the active form of vitamin B12) and the mineral selenium
  • Layer 2: A layer of amino acids, including tyrosine, methionine and trimethylglycine; all known to be critical nutritional factors that can be depleted due to occasional stress or poor diet.
  • Layer 3: A blend of two well-researched botanicals that have been studied for their effects on occasional stress: Magnolia and Rhodiola
"Genetic variations of the COMT gene as quite common.   Depending on their outcome scientists often classify individuals with these variants as either 'warriors' or 'worriers.' Warriors have high levels of COMT and a greater capacity to deal with stress at the expense of cognitive performance. Worriers have lower COMT levels, lower pain threshold and an increased sensitivity to stress. If you find yourself identying with the worrier type, you may benefit from Catechol." This 100% vegetarian product contains no sugar, salt, gluten, wheat, yeast, soy, eggs or dairy, no preservatives, color or flavors, and no artificial ingredients.
Dosage & Information
Directions Two (2) capsules 1-3 times daily. Best taken away from food.
Size 60 capsules
Usable by all types? Yes, but more commonly needed by blood type O

post_title: Allergy Panels -240 Complete Food Panel- IgG
post_content:
It is not always the usual suspects.. Our Complete 240 Food Panel is our most comprehensive food panel. It can help to identify both common and less obvious foods that may be contributing to inflammation. Food sensitivities can cause a wide range of symptoms and disorders. The foods that cause these delayed reactions are often hard to diagnose because of the time between consumption and the physical reaction. The IgG food allergy test offers a useful tool for detecting the foods causing this response. The results are patient specific and provide an easy, precise and effective starting point for dietary manipulation. IgG (immunoglobulin G) testing is a useful guide for practitioners to structure an elimination diet for many chronic health conditions. The foods that cause these delayed reactions are often hard to diagnose because of the time between consumption and the physical reaction. Generally, an IgG reaction occurs hours to days after exposure to these food antigens. The IgG food allergy test offers a useful tool for detecting the foods causing this response. The results are patient specific and provide an easy, precise and effective starting point for dietary manipulation. When doing an IgG test, it is recommended to eat a large variety of foods in the two weeks prior to testing. Include as many of the foods that are being tested in the specific allergy panel you have chosen. Be aware that if foods are not included in the diet during this time, false negative results may be obtained as recent exposure to these foods may be required for antibodies to be present in the blood. It is recommended that IgG allergy testing is only performed for infants greater than 18 months of age.

Associated conditions:

  • Fatigue
  • Headaches
  • Irritable Bowel
  • Hard to define health problems

post_title: Discover Your True Age - Telomere Testing
post_content:
NOTE:  This test is ONLY AVAILABLE TO AUSTRALIAN RESIDENTS.

Are you aging faster than you would like due to telomere shortening?

Current research shows that telomere shortening contributes to cellular aging and susceptibility to metabolic disorders and chronic disease. According to scientific research, telomere shortening may contribute to aging and age-related conditions. Telomeres are segments of DNA found at the ends of chromosomes. They can be prematurely shortened when exposed to environmental chemicals, oxidation, inflammation, and stress. This leads to DNA damage and contributes to early cell death.

How old are you really?

Example

As per the above image, your biological age is 57.10 and your chronological age is 64.10, that means your 7 years younger in terms of your underlying health.  Chronological age is how long you have existed. Biological age is how old your cells are. post_content:
NOTE:  This test is ONLY AVAILABLE TO AUSTRALIAN RESIDENTS.

Bad Breath?  Consider Oral microbiome Mapping

The oral microbiome is identified as one of the significant microbial ecosystems in the human body and has the potential to impact our health in various ways. An oral microbiome test Australia can help detect dysbiosis in the oral microbiome, identified through the analysis of genetic material, which can have both local effects (e.g., dental caries, periodontitis, gingivitis, oral cancers), as well as systemic effects (e.g., neurodegeneration, diabetes, cardiovascular disease). Systemic diseases can arise when pathogenic bacteria in the oral cavity translocate into the gut in the presence of oral-gut barrier disruption. Fortunately, many unfavorable symptoms can be reversed by re-establishing symbiosis in the oral microbiome through dietary and lifestyle changes.

Understanding the Oral Microbiome

The oral microbiome is a complex ecosystem of microscopic organisms that inhabit the oral cavity. This intricate community includes various species of bacteria, viruses, fungi, and other microorganisms, all playing crucial roles in maintaining oral health. The balance of these organisms is influenced by numerous factors, including diet, lifestyle, and environmental conditions. A healthy oral microbiome is essential for preventing oral diseases and supporting overall well-being.

Common Conditions, Oral Cancers, and Pathogenic Bacteria

  • Bad Breath
  • Buring pain in mouth
  • Candida (Oral)
  • Dental caries
  • Gingivitis
  • Health problems in the mouth
  • Periodontitis
  • Oral cancers
  • Neurodegeneration (Alzheimer’s)
  • Diabetes
  • CVD (cardiovascular disease)
  • Atherosclerosis
  • Female reproductive health
  • Persistent infections of the ears, nose, throat
  • Low oral immunity
  • Unexplained mouth sores or pain
  • Oral infections

What we test for:

  • Campylobacter rectus
  • Capnocytophaga gingivalis
  • Enterococcus faecalis
  • Fusobacterium nucleatum
  • Parvimonas micra
  • Peptostreptococcus anaerobius
  • Prevotella intermedia
  • Streptococcus mutans
  • actinomycetemcomitans
  • Porphyromonas gingivalis
  • Tannerella forsythia
  • Treponema denticola
  • Staphylococcus aureus
  • Pseudomonas aeruginosa
  • Acinetobacter species
  • Haemophilus species
  • Candida albicans
  • Candida species
  • Streptococcus salivarius
  • Lactobacillus species
These bacteria are identified through oral microbiome analysis.

Oral Microbiome Mapping Techniques

Oral microbiome mapping techniques involve the use of advanced technologies to analyze the composition and diversity of the oral microbiome. One of the most common methods is quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR), which allows for the precise measurement and quantification of specific microorganisms in the oral cavity. Additionally, next-generation sequencing offers a more comprehensive understanding by identifying a broader range of microbial species. Oral microbiome sequencing further enhances this understanding by providing detailed insights into the microbial communities present. These techniques provide valuable insights into the oral microbiome, helping to identify imbalances and potential health risks.

About the Oral Microbiome Mapping test

After you purchase the Oral Microbiome Mapping test, you will receive a simple saliva test kit in the mail. The test kit comes with:
  • A buccal swab home saliva test kit
  • Full instructions and laboratory request form
  • Complete instructions & tools for taking the test
  • Pre-paid express post envelope to return the test to the laboratory (Australia Only).
Understanding the oral microbiome is crucial as it significantly influences how the body functions, impacting various aspects of health and well-being. Oral microbiome test results are sent to one of our professional health practitioners within 5-7 business days for evaluation.

The Connection Between Oral and Gut Microbiome

The oral microbiome and gut microbiome are intricately connected, with the oral cavity serving as a gateway to the gastrointestinal tract. This connection, often referred to as the oral-gut axis, highlights the significant interplay between these two microbial ecosystems.
  1. Oral Cavity Translocate: Pathogenic bacteria in the oral cavity can translocate into the gut, leading to oral-gut barrier disruption. This disruption can have far-reaching consequences, including the development of systemic diseases such as cardiovascular disease.
  2. Gut Microbiota: The gut microbiota is composed of trillions of microscopic organisms that work together to maintain a delicate balance. An imbalance of the gut microbiota, also known as dysbiosis, can lead to a range of health issues, including gastrointestinal disease and oral cancers.
  3. Short Chain Fatty Acids: The gut microbiota produces short chain fatty acids, which are essential for maintaining a healthy gut barrier. A decrease in short chain fatty acid production can lead to oral-gut barrier disruption, allowing pathogenic bacteria to translocate into the gut.
  4. Opportunistic Pathogens: Opportunistic pathogens, such as opportunistic bacteria, can take advantage of an imbalance in the oral microbiome and gut microbiome, leading to a range of health issues.
  5. Dietary and Lifestyle Changes: Making dietary and lifestyle changes, such as limiting sugar intake and increasing fiber consumption, can help to promote a healthy balance of the oral microbiome and gut microbiome.
  6. Comprehensive Microbiome Test: A comprehensive microbiome test, such as the Oral Microbiome Mapping test, can provide valuable insights into the balance of the oral microbiome and gut microbiome, allowing for personalized recommendations for improvement.
  7. Genetic Material: The genetic material of the microbes present in the oral cavity and gut can provide valuable information about the balance of the oral microbiome and gut microbiome.
By understanding the connection between the oral microbiome and gut microbiome, individuals can take steps to promote a healthy balance of both, leading to improved overall health and well-being.

Impact on Overall Health

The oral microbiome imbalance has a significant impact on overall health. Dysbiosis, or an imbalance in the oral microbiome, can lead to various oral health issues such as dental caries, periodontitis, and oral cancers. Moreover, the oral microbiome is linked to systemic diseases, including cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and neurodegeneration. Disruption of the oral-gut barrier can result in the translocation of pathogenic bacteria from the oral cavity to the gut, contributing to gastrointestinal tract disorders. A comprehensive microbiome test can provide valuable insights into the oral microbiome, helping to identify potential health risks. Implementing dietary and lifestyle changes can help restore balance to the oral microbiome, promoting overall health and well-being.

Lipothiamine is a specialized dietary supplement combining 50mg of TTFD (thiamine tetrahydrofurfuryl disulfide) with alpha-lipoic acid for enhanced Vitamin B1 absorption. Manufactured in a GMP-approved facility, it features enteric-coated tablets for optimal delivery and quality.

Why is this a better vitamin B1?

Some people carry genetic mutations that make it harder for them to use their vitamin b1 as thiamine.  Lipothiamine is a fatty vitamin B1 or fat soluble form of vitamin B1 which makes it easier for some people to get the proper benefits for vitamin B1.

Vitamin B1 Essentials

B1 is essential for energy production, brain function and digestion & helps the body make use of protein.

Deficiency signs of vitamin B1

(Beriberi), Tender muscles, eye pains, irritability, poor concentration, prickly legs, poor memory, stomach pains, constipation, tingling hands, rapid heartbeat, muscle weakness, muscle wasting, peripheral neuropathy, motor nerve conduction problems, tender calves, enlarged heart, heart failure, tachycardia, peripheral edema, anorexia, vomiting, lactic acidosis, altered heart rate, ophthalmoplegia (paralysis of the ocular muscles), nystagmus (constant, involuntary eyeball movement), ataxia (impaired muscle coordination), loss of recent memory, and confusion.

Vitamin B1 works with

other B vitamins, magnesium, manganese,  molybdenum & alpha-ketoglutarate.

Robbers of vitamin B1

Antibiotics, tea, coffee, stress, birth-control pill, alcohol, alkaline agents, e.g. baking powder, sulphur dioxide (preservative 220), cooking and food refining / processing, genetic mutations associated with Thiamin Degradation.  You can be tested for genetic mutations of thiamin here.

post_content:
The EndoMAP is the most advanced dried urine test, designed to provide an in-depth assessment of hormonal, metabolic, and environmental influences on hormone health. This all-in-one profile delivers comprehensive insights into the four key hormone pathways—estrogen, androgen, progesterone, and glucocorticoid—offering a complete picture of hormone production and metabolism. With a detailed dynamic steroid hormone cascade chart, the EndoMAP highlights hormone values, and metabolites to help practitioners navigate complex cases and guide targeted treatment strategies. What Makes EndoMAP Unique?
  • Endocrine Disruptors & Heavy Metals
  • Nutritional Organic Acids
Why Choose EndoMAP?
  • Non-invasive collection via dried urine
  • Ideal for monitoring patients on HRT
  • Supports assessment of:
    • Hormonal imbalances
    • Infertility and low libido
    • Fatigue and irritability
    • Weight management concerns
    • Sleep disturbances
    • Mood disorders, brain fog, and sleep-onset issues
EndoSTAT is a simple dried urine test that can be done at your home or office.  The test includes:
  • An authorized urine specimen order form
  • A urine specimen test kit
  • Complete instructions for taking the test for you and the pathology
Test results are sent to one of our professional health practitioners within 7-10 business days for evaluation.  Our practitioners contact you with the results and recommendations on any findings via email, mail or phone.

post_content:
NOTE:  This test is ONLY AVAILABLE TO AUSTRALIAN RESIDENTS. The Copper, Ceruloplasmin & Zinc profiles provides useful information and is an excellent way to determine immune status and the nutritional intake and/or absorption of zinc and copper. Zinc is an essential marker for the proper functioning of the immune system. Zinc is required for the activity of over 300 enzymes and is involved in most major metabolic pathways. Either a deficiency or excess in this marker can affect the human body significantly causing a wide variety of symptoms. The immune system depends on zinc in almost every aspect. Zinc has an inverse relationship with copper in the body. This means that as zinc goes down, copper goes up and the same principle applies vice versa. Adequate copper levels are essential for the growth of new blood vessels, wound healing, and recovering from heart attacks and strokes. When levels are only slightly above normal physiological amounts, copper can be toxic. Any mild abnormality or impairment of liver function can lead to copper excess. Ceruloplasmin is an important marker often ordered in conjunction with copper. Caeruloplasmin is a copper-containing enzyme that plays a role in the body’s iron metabolism. The liver binds copper to apocaeruloplasmin to produce caeruloplasmin and then releases it into the bloodstream. About 95 per cent of the copper in the blood is bound to caeruloplasmin.

Symptoms

  • Gastrointestinal and Digestive Health
    • Abdominal pain
    • Nausea
  • Nutritional and Dietary Symptoms
    • Chronic Fatigue
  • Mental and Emotional Health
    • Depression
    • Schizophrenia
  • Other Health Conditions
    • Digestive issues
    • Headaches
    • Immune deficiencies
    • Pyroluria
    • Anemia

Testing for:

  • % free Copper
  • Ceruloplasmin
  • Copper
  • Cu/Zn ratio
  • Zinc

About the test kit:

  • An authorized blood specimen order form that you take to your local accredited pathology for collection of your blood (Find a pathology near you here).
  • A blood specimen test kit for the pathology to use to collect your blood sample
  • Complete instructions for taking the test for you and the pathology
  • Test results are sent to one of our professional health practitioners within 7 business days for evaluation.  Our practitioners contact you with the results and recommendations on any findings via email, mail or phone.
